Key Match Events: Bryce Harper was 0-for-4 with a strikeout in a 4-2 Game 7 NLCS loss to the Arizona Diamondbacks, leaving two on with a fly ball to left center in a deflating seventh.
Pre-Game Insights: Bryce Harper believes the Phillies have what it takes to keep contending and that their owner, John Middleton, will not relent in his pursuit to return a world championship trophy to Citizens Bank Park.
Post-Match Reflections: Bryce Harper expressed his gratitude to the fan base but acknowledged that a World Series triumph in his career-long quest remains elusive.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies had a 2-0 edge on Arizona in the Final Four, then lost four of the final five, the last two at home.
Others: Bryce Harper promised that the Phillies will 'be back' in 2024 and expect the team to be ready to go on Feb. 15.
